page.title: 01Brackley area general
page.content: Our twelve square kilometres of land is mostly farmland. There are three farms in the area. The A43 goes through Brackley joining Oxford to Northampton and, with so much traffic going through, the roads are starting to deteriorate. Evenley is a pretty village south of Brackley. Evenley Hall, which is a large old house owned by the National Children's Trust is between Evenley and Brackley and has a large park area. Astwick is an abandoned village south-west of Brackley. All the houses have crumbled and nobody lives there. The southern part of Brackley itself is in our area. The population estimate (based on the last census) is 8000. Brackley is within easy reach of several large towns such as Northampton (20 miles), Oxford (20 miles), Coventry (37 miles) and Stratford (30 miles).
